Generation I.Red: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one.
Generation I.Yellow: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
Generation I.Stadium: Moves incredibly quickly and shreds its enemy with its razor-sharp scythes. On rare occasions, it flies with its wings.

Generation II.Gold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
Generation II.Silver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible.
Generation II.Crystal: It's very proud of its speed. It moves so fast that its opponent does not even know what knocked it down.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pok é mon 's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
Generation III.Sapphire: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pok é mon 's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
Generation III.Emerald: Its blindingly fast speed adds to the sharpness of its twin forearm scythes. The scythes can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
Generation III.FireRed: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
Generation III.LeafGreen: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of itself.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.
Generation IV.Platinum: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective coloration makes it invisible.

Generation V.Black: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
Generation V.White: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
Generation V.Black 2: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
Generation V.White 2: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.

Generation VI.X: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
Generation VI.Y: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.

Generation VII.Sun: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
Generation VII.Moon: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its two sharp scythes are more than just weapons. It uses them with dexterity to dress its prey before eating.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Some call it a ninja. Its movements— imperceptibly quick—are sufficient to cleave the air in two. It's very popular in Alola.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.

Generation VIII.Sword: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
Generation VIII.Shield: If you come across an area in a forest where a lot of the trees have been cut down, what you've found is a Scyther's territory.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey’s attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
Generation IX.Violet: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
